intro: Diplotaxis tenuifolia f. integrifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf synnema, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately compound leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to harsh conditions. Its foliage is often densely packed, providing a distinctive appearance, while its roots are deep, aiding in water retention. This variety is noted for its compact growth habit and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
